question.body: Which of the following is not matched with its proper description?

multiple_choice.choice: Keratinocytes are found in the upper level of the skin and are usually dead.
Basal cells are stem cells that can reproduce.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Keratinocytes are found above the basal layer and the outermost ones die and are sloughed off the skin.
Incorrect. Basal cells are stem cells that divide by mitosis to produce new keratinocytes.
Correct. Merkel cells respond to light touch.
Incorrect. Langerhans cells are dendritic cells that can engulf any foreign organism that gets into the epidermis cell layers.
